Acolyte: I judge others harshly, and myself even more severely.
Charlatan: I can't resist a pretty face.
Criminal: When I see something valuable, I can't think about anything but how to steal it.
Criminal (Spy): When I see something valuable, I can't think about anything but how to steal it.
Entertainer: I'll do anything to win fame and renown.
Entertainer (Gladiator): I'll do anything to win fame and renown.
Fisher: I am judgmental, especially of those I deem homebodies or otherwise lazy.
Folk Hero: The tyrant who rules my land will stop at nothing to see me killed.
Guild Artisan: I'll do anything to get my hands on something rare or priceless.
Guild Artisan (Guild Merchant): I'll do anything to get my hands on something rare or priceless.
Haunted One: I have certain rituals that I must follow every day. I can never break them.
Hermit: Now that I've returned to the world, I enjoy its delights a little too much.
Marine: I grow combative and unpredictable when I drink.
Noble: I secretly believe that everyone is beneath me.
Noble (Knight): I secretly believe that everyone is beneath me.
Outlander: I am too enamored of ale, wine, and other intoxicants.
Sage: I am easily distracted by the promise of information.
Sailor: I follow orders, even if I think they're wrong.
Sailor (Pirate): I follow orders, even if I think they're wrong.
Shipwright: I don't know when to throw something away. You never know when it might be useful again.
Smuggler: Lying is reflexive, and I sometimes engage in it without realizing.
Soldier: The monstrous enemy we faced in battle still leaves me quivering with fear.
Urchin: If I'm outnumbered, I will run away from a fight.

Acolyte: I put too much trust in those who wield power within my temple's hierarchy.
Anthropologist: I talk to myself, and I don't make friends easily.
Charlatan: I'm always in debt. I spend my ill-gotten gains on decadent luxuries faster than I bring them in.
Criminal: When faced with a choice between money and my friends, I usually choose the money.
Criminal (Spy): When faced with a choice between money and my friends, I usually choose the money.
Entertainer: I'm a sucker for a pretty face.
Entertainer (Gladiator): I'm a sucker for a pretty face.
Fisher: I become depressed and anxious if I'm away from the sea too long.
Folk Hero: I'm convinced of the significance of my destiny, and blind to my shortcomings and the risk of failure.
Guild Artisan: I'm quick to assume that someone is trying to cheat me.
Guild Artisan (Guild Merchant): I'm quick to assume that someone is trying to cheat me.
Haunted One: I assume the worst in people.
Hermit: I harbor dark, bloodthirsty thoughts that my isolation and meditation failed to quell.
Marine: I find civilian life difficult and struggle to say the right thing in social situations.
Noble: I hide a truly scandalous secret that could ruin my family forever.
Noble (Knight): I hide a truly scandalous secret that could ruin my family forever.
Outlander: There's no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest.
Sage: Most people scream and run when they see a demon. I stop and take notes on its anatomy.
Sailor: I'll say anything to avoid having to do extra work.
Sailor (Pirate): I'll say anything to avoid having to do extra work.
Shipwright: I get frustrated to the point of distraction by shoddy craftsmanship.
Smuggler: I tend to assess my relationships in terms of profit and loss.
Soldier: I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.
Urchin: Gold seems like a lot of money to me, and I'll do just about anything for more of it.

Acolyte: My piety sometimes leads me to blindly trust those that profess faith in my god.
Anthropologist: I believe that I'm intellectually superior to people from other cultures and have much to teach them.
Charlatan: I'm convinced that no one could ever fool me the way I fool others.
Criminal: If there's a plan, I'll forget it. If I don't forget it, I'll ignore it.
Criminal (Spy): If there's a plan, I'll forget it. If I don't forget it, I'll ignore it.
Entertainer: A scandal prevents me from ever going home again. That kind of trouble seems to follow me around.
Entertainer (Gladiator): A scandal prevents me from ever going home again. That kind of trouble seems to follow me around.
Fisher: I have lived a hard life and find it difficult to empathize with others.
Folk Hero: The people who knew me when I was young know my shameful secret, so I can never go home again.
Guild Artisan: No one must ever learn that I once stole money from guild coffers.
Guild Artisan (Guild Merchant): No one must ever learn that I once stole money from guild coffers.
Haunted One: I feel no compassion for the dead. They're the lucky ones.
Hermit: I am dogmatic in my thoughts and philosophy.
Marine: My intensity can drive others away.
Noble: I too often hear veiled insults and threats in every word addressed to me, and I'm quick to anger.
Noble (Knight): I too often hear veiled insults and threats in every word addressed to me, and I'm quick to anger.
Outlander: I remember every insult I've received and nurse a silent resentment toward anyone who's ever wronged me.
Sage: Unlocking an ancient mystery is worth the price of a civilization.
Sailor: Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
Sailor (Pirate): Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
Shipwright: Though I am an excellent crafter, my work tends to look as though it belongs on a ship.
Smuggler: I believe everyone has a price and am cynical toward those who present themselves as virtuous.
Soldier: I made a terrible mistake in battle that cost many lives—and I would do anything to keep that mistake secret.
Urchin: I will never fully trust anyone other than myself.

Acolyte: I am inflexible in my thinking.
Anthropologist: I've picked up some unpleasant habits living among goblins, lizardfolk, or orcs.
Charlatan: I'm too greedy for my own good. I can't resist taking a risk if there's money involved.
Criminal: I have a 'tell' that reveals when I'm lying.
Criminal (Spy): I have a 'tell' that reveals when I'm lying.
Entertainer: I once satirized a noble who still wants my head. It was a mistake that I will likely repeat.
Entertainer (Gladiator): I once satirized a noble who still wants my head. It was a mistake that I will likely repeat.
Fisher: I am inclined to tell long-winded stories at inopportune times.
Folk Hero: I have a weakness for the vices of the city, especially hard drink.
Guild Artisan: I'm never satisfied with what I have—I always want more.
Guild Artisan (Guild Merchant): I'm never satisfied with what I have—I always want more.
Hermit: I let my need to win arguments overshadow friendships and harmony.
Marine: I hold grudges and have difficulty forgiving others.
Noble: I have an insatiable desire for carnal pleasures.
Noble (Knight): I have an insatiable desire for carnal pleasures.
Outlander: I am slow to trust members of other races, tribes, and societies.
Sage: I overlook obvious solutions in favor of complicated ones.
Sailor: Once I start drinking, it's hard for me to stop.
Sailor (Pirate): Once I start drinking, it's hard for me to stop.
Shipwright: I am so obsessed with sketching my ideas for elaborate inventions that I sometimes forget little thing like eating and sleeping.
Smuggler: I struggle to trust the words of others.
Soldier: My hatred of my enemies is blinding and unreasoning.
Urchin: I'd rather kill someone in their sleep than fight fair.

Acolyte: I am suspicious of strangers and expect the worst of them.
Charlatan: I can't resist swindling people who are more powerful than me.
Criminal: I turn tail and run when things look bad.
Criminal (Spy): I turn tail and run when things look bad.
Entertainer: I have trouble keeping my true feelings hidden. My sharp tongue lands me in trouble.
Entertainer (Gladiator): I have trouble keeping my true feelings hidden. My sharp tongue lands me in trouble.
Fisher: I work hard, but I play harder.
Folk Hero: Secretly, I believe that things would be better if I were a tyrant lording over the land.
Guild Artisan: I would kill to acquire a noble title.
Guild Artisan (Guild Merchant): I would kill to acquire a noble title.
Haunted One: I am a purveyor of doom and gloom who lives in a world without hope.
Hermit: I'd risk too much to uncover a lost bit of knowledge.
Marine: I become irrational when innocent people are hurt.
Noble: In fact, the world does revolve around me.
Noble (Knight): In fact, the world does revolve around me.
Outlander: Violence is my answer to almost any challenge.
Sage: I speak without really thinking through my words, invariably insulting others.
Sailor: I can't help but pocket loose coins and other trinkets I come across.
Sailor (Pirate): I can't help but pocket loose coins and other trinkets I come across.
Shipwright: I'm judgmental of those who are not skilled with tools of some kind.
Smuggler: Few people know the real me.
Soldier: I obey the law, even if the law causes misery.
Urchin: It's not stealing if I need it more than someone else.

Acolyte: Once I pick a goal, I become obsessed with it to the detriment of everything else in my life.
Anthropologist: I wear a tribal mask and never take it off.
Charlatan: I hate to admit it and will hate myself for it, but I'll run and preserve my own hide if the going gets tough.
Criminal: An innocent person is in prison for a crime that I committed. I'm okay with that.
Criminal (Spy): An innocent person is in prison for a crime that I committed. I'm okay with that.
Entertainer: Despite my best efforts, I am unreliable to my friends.
Entertainer (Gladiator): Despite my best efforts, I am unreliable to my friends.
Fisher: I am obsessed with catching an elusive aquatic beast, often to the detriment of other pursuits.
Folk Hero: I have trouble trusting in my allies.
Guild Artisan: I'm horribly jealous of anyone who can outshine my handiwork. Everywhere I go, I'm surrounded by rivals.
Guild Artisan (Guild Merchant): I'm horribly jealous of anyone who can outshine my handiwork. Everywhere I go, I'm surrounded by rivals.
Haunted One: I talk to spirits that no one else can see.
Hermit: I like keeping secrets and won't share them with anyone.
Marine: I sometimes stay up all night listening to the ghosts of my fallen enemies.
Noble: By my words and actions, I often bring shame to my family.
Noble (Knight): By my words and actions, I often bring shame to my family.
Outlander: Don't expect me to save those who can't save themselves. It is nature's way that the strong thrive and the weak perish.
Sage: I can't keep a secret to save my life, or anyone else's.
Sailor: My pride will probably lead to my destruction.
Sailor (Pirate): My pride will probably lead to my destruction.
Shipwright: I sometimes take things that don't belong to me, especially if they are very well made.
Smuggler: Though I act charming, I feel nothing for others and don't know what friendship is.
Soldier: I'd rather eat my armor than admit when I'm wrong.
Urchin: People who can't take care of themselves get what they deserve.
